body.name: Yuasa YUAM7RH4H YTX14H Factory Activated H Series AGM Battery
features: Yuasa YTX H Series batteries offer even more increased power with up to 30% more cold cranking amps
Advanced lead-calcium technology – holds its specific gravity more than 3 times longer than conventional lead antimony batteries
Absorbed Glass Mat (AGM) separators absorb electrolyte making the battery nonspillable, the valve regulated design eliminates water loss and the need for refilling
Factory Activated (FA) – the battery is filled with electrolyte, sealed and charged at the factory

Size/Weight - Length: 6 in (150 mm), Width: 3 7/16 in (87 mm), Height: 6 3/4 in (145 mm), Weight with Acid (lbs.): 10.6; Specs - Capacity Ah: 12 @ 10HR, Regular Charge Current (Amp): 1.2, C.C.A. @ 0 °F (-18 °C): 240
body.description: Yuasa YTX H Series batteries offer even more increased power with up to 30% more cold cranking amps. Advanced lead-calcium technology – holds its specific gravity more than 3 times longer than conventional lead antimony batteries. Absorbed Glass Mat (AGM) separators absorb electrolyte making the battery nonspillable, the valve regulated design eliminates water loss and the need for refilling. Factory Activated (FA) – the battery is filled with electrolyte, sealed and charged at the factory. reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 6, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars My mistake, it does fit 2014 R1200GS
reviews.reviewText: You just need to remove the styrofoam bottom spacer if the battery you are replacing has it. Then, transfer the foam wrapper from the old battery to the new one, and voila! You are all set.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 31, 2014
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars It fits a 2006 Burgman 650 (AKA AN650) perfectly "like a glove" - attempting to clarify another user's experience.
reviews.reviewText: I am posting this mainly to give my personal experience and simultaneously try to clarify the potential context of another users review. That review said (somehow MISTAKENLY) that this YTX14H battery does not fit a Burgman 650. With all due respect to the reviewer... their review is 100% wrong... it is just plain false! I say this because (following a hunch) I ignored that review, ordered and installed the battery and found that it absolutely fits my 2006 Burgman 650 (AKA Suzuki AN650) perfectly and without any problems whatsoever. As a matter of fact... It "fits like a glove" & I am not sure as to why the other review says that it does not. I can only guess that maybe they did not purchase from "ships from and sold by Amazon.com"... In other words, they purchased from one of the alternate sellers on the right top area of the product page. I am further guessing... either those sellers accidentally sent the user the wrong battery or intentionally did so. As far as the quality of the battery... I can only say that it arrived fully charged from the factory & fresh (manufactured 5 months ago) It required zero charging before starting my bike with it. I gave it only 4 stars because I have not used it much so I can not speak to the battery life or dependability yet. Another battery note specifically for Burgman Riders (while I am at it). If you have been researching you might have come to the conclusion that a very popular Burgman DIY youtube guru, whose user name is L****e (also famous on Burgmanusa.com user group) recommends the Motobatt brand battery. I was also under that impression until I stumbled across a reference to him having a bad experience and a complete change of heart on that brand of battery. I emailed L****e directly to ask his opinion on the motobatt and he confirmed that he no longer recommended it because the Motobatt failed / went bad very quickly. I asked him what he uses now and he said Yuasa. As a result, I invite you to revisit your original research because "smart people learn from their mistakes and ingenious people learn from other peoples mistakes" :-) Also, (per my conversation with Yuasa tech support) please note that only the "YTX14H" (with no other letters whatsoever) is the high performance version of the battery and the only version that is "factory activated". High performance means higher cold cranking amps. I don't think the high performance is necessary for the Burgman... (but when I purchased) it only cost a few bucks more so I "went for it". Yuasa said that they recommend "factory activated" because the battery sits on an angle and thus should be sealed at the factory. That being said, my personal opinion is that you are probably good with or without a "factory activated" battery. But don't take my word for it, call Yuasa tech support at (866) 431-4784 and ask them. So to all Burgman 650 riders out there... If you want this battery... just be sure to order from the "ships from and sold by Amazon.com" supplier and you should have no worries.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 3, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Strong Right out of the box
reviews.reviewText: Was having a problem with my battery only turning the engine over a couple of times then running out of power. I replaced it with this YUASA battery and no more problems.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 19, 2013
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Battery Dead in 4 Months
reviews.reviewText: I searched high and low for the battery with the most cranking amps because I have a V-Twin Buell XB12R. This battery was dead in 4 mths and I was Jumping my bike every other day. I thought for sure it wasnt the battery because it was brand new. After paying $85 at the Stealership to have my charging system checked I was told it was just the battery. $85 + $114 for a new battery from Stealership = My dumb a** buying Yuasa battery in the first place.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 29, 2012
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars YUASA batteries are Best
reviews.reviewText: There are so many motorcycle batteries available on the market these days, but you just can't beat the lasting ability of a Yuasa battery. Many motorcycle will not run without a charged battery. Many times, if your battery goes dead, your bike will stop running, so even a jump start will not save the day. If you are by yourself with a dead battery, you better be prepared for a possible long walk.Every Yuasa battery I've owned have lasted four years or longer, even in a extremely Hot city like where I live where you're lucky to get 2-3 years from a car battery. When not riding, the batteries on all four of my bikes are plugged into a trickle charger, because the worst thing you can do to your battery is to allow it to become drained, regardless of the brand.Yuasa might cost a few dollars more, but when comparing the CCA's, they are far superior to all others, including their longevity.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars I wouldn’t call it a good fit.
reviews.reviewText: Guaranteed fit well it doesn’t fit compared to the original battery. The battery is shorter than stock and does not contact the plastic battery lock support bracket which would allow the battery to move around in the case where the battery goes. This would allow the cables to loosen up.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 14, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great, less expensive replacement for ytz14s
reviews.reviewText: Cheaper, more powerful replacement of my ytz14s. If you have the extra inch height. Slight modification and it fit my ST1300.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 24, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Fits Suzuki Burgman 650 Scooter
reviews.reviewText: I would have given this 5 stars but contrary to the listing, this battery came with electrolyte in a separate container which needed to be loaded into the battery and then charged for 12 hours. The posting states "Factory activated - filled, sealed and charged at the factory" which was not my experience.I will say it was easy enough to load the electrolyte. The container is sealed and when you place it over the battery the seals are punctured without any risk of leakage. Luckily I have a suitable battery charger and was able to get things going but was not what I was expecting.Battery working well now that it's all charged up.
Dimensioni identiche alla batteria originale, per il GS 1200 (2018).Ora il motore si avvia senza indecisioni.
Sehr schnelle Lieferung. Alles, wie gewünscht!Scheint eine der wenigen Batterien für meine K1300S zu sein, die die richtige Spannung liefert!Gerne wieder!
Bonne batterie mais vu trop tard sur Ebay un modèle BS moins cher
